title: Graffiti goes hi-tech
content:
Somebody's figured out a way to output vector images via [spray paint!](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142425/http:/www.hektor.ch/)   
   
I can see it now: graffiti artist start outsourcing the designs to [India](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142425/http:/www.wired.com/wired/archive/12.02/india.html?tw=wn_tophead_8) to Increase production.   
   
The resolution's pretty good. I think it's about 3dpi (drips per inch ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142425im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)). Click on the jpeg link to see how it handle type. But to really see it in action, check out the mpeg.   
   
Fairwarining: when you click on the jpeg link it brings up about ten or so pop ups of sample work, each in their own window.
author: roballoo

comments.content: Absolutely love this! Very inspiring for installation ideas.
This is great. It seems like something my dad would do if he was fifty years younger.

Here's the BBC story on the device - [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/3045158.stm](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142425/http:/news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/3045158.stm) it was in the news back in July. However, I kind of remember other people doing similar things in the past.   
   
Si
